#summary Setting up your GWT project to use gwt-earth-3

=Getting Started=
  # Visit [http://code.google.com/apis/maps/signup.html http://code.google.com/apis/maps/signup.html] to sign up for an Earth Key for your domain. For development purposes you can enter a host name of 'localhost'
  # Add the following bootstrap code to the `<head>` of your GWT application host file:
{{{
     <script src="http://www.google.com/jsapi?key=_your map key here_"></script>
     <script type="text/javascript">
        google.load("earth", "1");
     </script>
}}}
  # Add the following module import to your GWT module:  
{{{
      <inherits name='com.nitrous.gwt.earth.GwtEarthAPI'/>
}}}
  # Add the following to your project CSS file:
{{{
    .map3dcontainer {
	border: 1px solid silver;
	width: 100%;
	height: 100%;
    } 
    .map3d {
	width: 100%;
	height: 100%;
    }
}}}
  # Add [http://code.google.com/p/gwt-earth-3/downloads/list GwtEarth3-x.x.jar] to your project build path
  # See [https://code.google.com/p/gwt-earth-3/source/browse/trunk/src/com/nitrous/gwt/earth/client/demo/EarthDemo.java EarthDemo.java] for an example of how to get started with the code.
